intro: Mahernia coronopifolia, commonly known as the crownleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers with yellow centers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is well adapted to arid conditions, showing succulent features that help it store water. Mahernia coronopifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
